intro: Helopus pilosus, commonly known as the hairy helopus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and sometimes edible parts. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late spring. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it the common name "hairy helopus." This species is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
